sources.title: Bulldog Drummond (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Bulldog Drummond is an adventure/crime film that spawned a long running series of movies. While this wasn't the first film to attempt to capture the popularity of the series of mystery novels on which it was based, this was the first attempt with sound, which helped launch the series. Lead actor Ronald Colman would be given an Oscar nod for his role in the picture.¬†

Stars: Ronald Colman, Joan Bennett, Lilyan Tashman
Director: F. Richard Jones
Writer: H. C. McNeile aka "Sapper"
Colman stars as Hugh "Bulldog" Drummond, a restless British officer whose search for excitement leads him into a sinister web of kidnapping and intrigue. Joan Bennett co-stars as the damsel in distress who pulls Drummond into danger, supported by a stellar cast including Montagu Love, Lawrence Grant, Lilyan Tashman, and Wilson Benge.

A defining moment in early sound cinema, this 1929 mystery thriller from The Samuel Goldwyn Company marked Ronald Colman‚Äôs first appearance in a talking picture‚Äîand earned him an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor. Directed by F. Richard Jones and distributed by United Artists, the film brings to life the popular literary character Bulldog Drummond, created by H. C. McNeile.

Praised for its witty dialogue, brisk pacing, and confident use of early sound technology, the film blends crime, adventure, and mystery with stylish flair. Its success helped establish the gentleman-adventurer archetype on screen and remains a key entry in both Colman's career and the evolution of the detective genre in Hollywood.

Ideal for fans of classic mysteries, early talkies, and vintage British pulp fiction adaptations.

sources.title: DOULGLAS FAIRBANKS JR presents Bulldog Drummond
sources.description: "Douglas Fairbanks Jr Presents Bulldog Drummond and 'The Ludlow Affair'" Series 5 Episode 13 (28 January 1957) This was made as a pilot for a possible series. When it wasn't picked up the pilot was used as an episode in the "Douglas Fairbanks Presents" series. Cast Douglas Fairbanks Jr - Host Robert Beatty - Bulldog Drummond Greta Gynt - Mrs. Harriette Ludlow Michael Ripper - Kelly William Franklyn - Roger Benning Harry Lane - Kinsella John Le Mesurier - Inspector Burroughs Michael Anthony - Dr. Felix Ludlow Ian Fleming - Churchill US production shot in the UK in 1952

sources.title: Bulldog Drummond 1929 colorized (Ronald Coleman)
sources.description: A bored WWI veteran gets a request for help from a young woman whose uncle is being held captive in a nursing home by villains trying to extort his fortune from him. Ronald Colman as Hugh 'Bulldog' Drummond Claud Allister as Algy Lawrence Grant as Dr. Lakington Montagu Love as Peterson Wilson Benge as Danny Joan Bennett as Phyllis Lilyan Tashman as Irma Charles Sellon as Travers I colorized this using AI software that doesn't always get the colors right, but I think it looks fairly natural. Hopefully a more professional job will be done someday.

metadata.Plot: Hugh 'Bulldog' Drummond is a British WWI veteran who longs for some excitement after he returns to the humdrum existence of civilian life. He gets what he's looking for when a girl requests his help in freeing her uncle from a nursing home. She believes the home is just a front and that her uncle is really being held captive while the culprits try to extort his fortune from him.
metadata.Actors: Ronald Colman, Claud Allister, Lawrence Grant
